heading: ebay browser tracks auctions
subheading: a new web browser designed specifically for ebay users lets buyers and sellers keep track of multiple bidding wars at once. you'll never miss an auction again. by lindsey arent.
author: lindsey arent
text: now ebay auction addicts can increase their bidding prowess with the help of a browser that tracks multiple auctions at once. the auction browser, launched thursday, is designed specifically for ebay users who don’t like to let a single auction slip through their fingers.while viewing an auction on ebay's site, a user can keep track of various bidding wars by clicking on them and adding them to the browser's auction tracker."users won't have to miss an auction," said bob hays, president of zcurve software, the indianapolis company that designed the tool.the browser's auction tracker displays a list of ebay auctions selected by the user. it automatically updates current bid prices, bidder information, auction opening and closing times, and even converts time zone differences.auction tracker can be configured to automatically update bid prices at adjustable intervals ranging from 10 seconds to 60 minutes.other features include an alarm that sounds when an auction's cutoff time is near, and an auction archive, which allows users to keep detailed notes on everything they've ever bought or sold off the site.the browser is a customized version of microsoft internet explorer that runs on microsoft windows 95, 98, and nt operating systems.a free demo of the browser, which will sell for us$19.95, is currently available on the auction browser web site.
